clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For use as an alternative to adrenaline as a localising agent provided that local ischaemia is not essential

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Felypressin is a synthetic analog of lypressin or vasopressin with a greater vasoconstrictor activity than antidiuretic action It is used primarily as a hemostatic

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of hypotension can be increased when Patent Blue is combined with Felypressin
Thyrotropin alfa may increase the vasoconstricting activities of Felypressin
Liothyronine may increase the vasoconstricting activities of Felypressin
Levothyroxine may increase the vasoconstricting activities of Felypressin
Liotrix may increase the vasoconstricting activities of Felypressin
Tiratricol may increase the vasoconstricting activities of Felypressin
Thyroid porcine may increase the vasoconstricting activities of Felypressin
The risk or severity of hypertension can be increased when Felypressin is combined with Lidocaine
